why wont cups work?: Linux kyleb 2.6.12-9-386 #1 Mon Oct 10 13:14:36 BST 2005 i686 GNU/Linux
Are there any hints in the logs under /var/log/cups/?
E [19/Oct/2005:19:21:55 -0400]  StartListening: Unable to bind socket for address 7f000001:631 - Cannot assign requested address.
Maybe you haven't got IPv6 set up correctly, and hence can't bind to the IPv6 loopback address?
Well, it appears that your cups thinks it's a good idea to use ipv6 (possibly in addition to ipv4).
If you have a process "cupsd" running, what does "lsof -p `pidof cupsd` | grep TCP" report?
